thread.title: Police Had A Full-Fledged Standoff With A Runaway Bull In New York - BuzzFeed News
thread.title_full: Police Had A Full-Fledged Standoff With A Runaway Bull In New York - BuzzFeed News

author: Julia Reinstein Buzzfeed News Reporter
title: Police Had A Full-Fledged Standoff With A Runaway Bull In New York - BuzzFeed News
text:
Police responded to the incident with a full-fledged standoff, cornering the animal in a resident’s backyard. 
A butcher told CBS2 the bull had escaped from a nearby slaughterhouse. ID: 10568885 2. Vladimir Vilsaint, a Jamaica resident, told BuzzFeed News he saw the bull on his way to work around 10:40 a.m. 
I'm on my way to work and see a cow walk right by me in Jamaica, Queens. Unbelievable... — Vladimir Vilsaint (@Soon2betheKing) “The cow sighting was awesome and happened really fast,” he said. “The cops had been trailing the cow like it had its own motorcade but they didn’t have their sirens on.” ID: 10568829 3. People near and far gathered to watch the brave creature’s journey to freedom. 
THE COW IS RUNNING DOWN THE STREET — Steve Kopack (@SteveKopack) ID: 10568951 
Got vid of bull escaping from cops in Queens from a nearby slaughterhouse. "move! Everybody run!" a cop yelled… https://t.co/CsMPZcpC2L — Edgar Sandoval (@edjsandoval) 
There's a high-speed cow chase in Queens right now. — John Haltiwanger (@jchaltiwanger) ID: 10568742 6. After a chase that lasted about two hours, police cornered the bull in a backyard, where it was tranquilized and taken into custody. 
The cow is in custody. And I'm not sure there is a better metaphor for America in this moment than this. — Jason Karsh (@jkarsh) An NYPD officer told BuzzFeed News he had “no idea” what would happen to the animal as of yet, despite conflicting reports that it would either be returned to the slaughterhouse or brought to an animal sanctuary. ID: 10569104 7. This isn’t the first time a bull or cow has ran loose in Queens. Or the second. A bull named Frank got loose on the campus of CUNY York College in April, and was then rescued by Jon Stewart. 
And in January of last year, a cow named Freddie got loose in Jamaica, from the same slaughterhouse that Tuesday’s bull reportedly escaped from. ID: 10569270 8. Of course, there were some great tweets. 
After all this running around the cow's going to need some... (•_•) ( •_•)>⌐■-■ (⌐■_■) extreme vetting. — Jason Sparks (@sparksjls) ID: 10569341 
How common is it for a cow to be out walking around in Queens? Probably about medium rare. — Charles Richter (@richterscale) 
If you see this cow, be sure to m -ve out of its way. https://t.co/Rfaw5sHnoV — Field Yates (@FieldYates) 
Where was this cow radicalized https://t.co/BCL5NSgDfM — G. Willow Wilson (@GWillowWilson) 
All this cow stuff is steak news. — Maureen Johnson (@maureenjohnson) We will update this story as more information becomes available. ID: 10569438 Julia Reinstein is a reporter for BuzzFeed News and is based in New York. Contact Julia Reinstein at .
